description: Erection of single storey side and rear extension with green roof and amendments to porch; conversion of roof space to habitable use including 2 side dormers with a covered terrace and associated internal alterations
decision_conditions: The proposed roof extensions, by reason of their siting in a visually prominent position, bulk, size and shape, would result in incongruous and poorly designed development on the roofslope of the property. The proposal would therefore represent unsympathetic additions to the host property, failing to relate to the architectural composition and read as subordinate, to the detriment of the character, appearance and visual amenities of the surrounding area, harming the Long Lane streetscene. The proposal would therefore be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHD 1, DMHB 11 and DMHB 12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020).

The proposed rear extension by reason of its footprint, siting, bulk, size and design, would result in incongruous form of development which fails to read as a subordinate addition to the host property. The proposal would therefore be an unsympathetic addition, harming the character and appearance of the property and the visual amenities of the surrounding area. The proposal would therefore be contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012), Policies DMHD 1, DMHB 11 and DMHB 12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part Two - Development Management Policies (January 2020).

On this decision notice policies from the Councils Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies appear first, then relevant Local Plan Part 2 (2020), then London Plan Policies (2016). Hillingdon's Full Council adopted the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part 1 - Strategic Policies on 8 November 2012 and the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 on 16 January 2020.
